ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Psychogenic Hearing Loss / Non-organic Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant discrepancy between elevated behavioral thresholds and normal objective measures (ABR, DPOAE, reflexes at reduced SL); history of anxiety and trauma.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial behavioral presentation suggested SNHL, but this was ruled out by normal electrophysiological findings (ABR and OAEs).

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess behavioral hearing sensitivity and monitor changes.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess the acoustic reflex arc; reflexes at reduced sensation levels can indicate recruitment or non-organic loss.
Objective assessment of neural integrity and threshold estimation to resolve discrepancies between behavioral and objective findings.
Objective assessment of cochlear outer hair cell function to rule out organic cochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation revealed an asymmetric mild-to-moderate sensorineural hearing loss. However, acoustic reflexes were obtained at reduced sensation levels, which is suspicious for cochlear recruitment or a non-organic component.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild to moderate SNHL in the right ear (PTA 40 dB HL); slight to mild SNHL in the left ear (PTA 20 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs commensurate with PTA (Right 40 dB, Left 20 dB); WRS 80% at 80 dB HL (Right) and 80% at 50 dB HL (Left).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal middle ear pressure and static admittance bilaterally (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes at reduced sensation levels; no decay.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Behavioral thresholds worsened significantly, suggesting mild-to-moderate loss bilaterally. However, objective testing (ABR and DPOAE) demonstrated normal cochlear and neural function with thresholds significantly better than behavioral responses, confirming non-organic hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Significant decrease in sensitivity; mild to moderate SNHL bilaterally (Right PTA 50 dB, Left PTA 45 dB).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs shifted (Right 50 dB, Left 45 dB); WRS 60% Right, 88% Left at 80 dB HL.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Normal latencies; Wave V repeatable to 25 dB HL (Left) and 15 dB HL (Right), indicating normal sensitivity.

tests.name: Otoacoustic Emissions (DPOAE)
tests.result_summary: Present and normal amplitudes 1000-6000 Hz, inconsistent with behavioral loss.

proposed_items: Referral to otologist for medical clearance (completed)
Reassessment of pure-tone and speech audiometry using ascending method
Discussion of results with patient's psychologist (with consent)
counseling_actions: Counsel on the discrepancy between behavioral and objective test results
Explain that objective tests show the inner ear and nerve are working normally
Re-instruct on test procedures to encourage consistent responses
Avoid implying malingering or psychological disorder directly during counseling

escalation.rationale_short: Psychogenic hearing loss identified; patient history of trauma (home invasion) requires psychological/psychiatric management.

follow_up_plan.objective: Reassess behavioral thresholds to establish organic hearing levels and facilitate psychological referral.

expected_outcome: Pure-tone audiometry (reassessment): Thresholds were measured to be within normal limits bilaterally (PTA Right 13 dB HL, Left 15 dB HL).
Speech audiometry (reassessment): SRTs were commensurate with PTA (Right 13 dB HL, Left 15 dB HL) and WRS were normal bilaterally (96%).
The patient did not appear to realize her behavioral responses were inconsistent with previous sessions.
The patient's psychologist reported she was a survivor of a violent home invasion and referred her for psychiatric consultation.
